examples.input:
A. The child hurt their knee.
B. The child started crying.

A. I washed the car.
B. My car got dirty.

A. Someone fainted.
B. Someone called 911.

A. The vase shattered on the floor.
B. A man accidently pushed the vase off a counter.

A. The woman who was walking on the street opened her umbrella.
B. It started raining.

A. There was a loud noise.
B. The boy lifted his eyes from the book.

A. The girl woke up covered in cold sweat.
B. The girl had a nightmare.

A. It started raining.
B. The driver turned the wipers on.

A. A man was covered in sticky red goo.
B. A watermelon exploded.

A. She noticed that she was out of toilet paper.
B. She went to the store and bought toilet paper.

A. A large object hit the Earth.
B. The dinosaurs became extinct.

A. The bottle was left open.
B. The soda went flat.

A. George plugged the laptop charger in.
B. The laptop ran out of battery.

A. Sunlight filled the room.
B. The curtains were opened.

A. The insect pollinated the tomato flowers.
B. Tomatoes grew on the vine.

A. The girl stepped onto the street.
B. The driver hit the brakes.

A. There was a wardrobe malfunction.
B. The performer ran off the stage.

A. A bird hit the engine.
B. The pilot turned on the "fasten seatbelts" light.

A. The man sipped the milk and spit it out.
B. The milk was left outside the fridge over night.

A. The man couldn't hear what the woman was saying.
B. The man turned down the music volume.

A. The meat spoiled.
B. The power was out for days.

A. A flower grew.
B. The gardener planted a seed.

A. The team won the game.
B. The team won the championship.

A. The door was locked.
B. The man climbed in through the window.

A. The ship capsized.
B. The wind blew strong.

A. The man robbed a gas station.
B. The man went to jail.

A. Jill won the lawsuit against Acme.
B. Acme paid Jill's legal fees.

A. School was cancelled.
B. There was a snowstorm.

A. The tenants noticed mold on the bathroom ceiling.
B. The tenants contacted their landlord.

A. I studied hard.
B. I got an A on the test.

A. The window broke.
B. The boy threw a rock.

A. The driver was pulled over and was fined.
B. The driver ran a red light.

A. The girl got detention.
B. The girl skipped school.

A. I flipped the switch.
B. Light filled the room.

A. I pulled the dog's tail.
B. The dog bit me.

A. The family went on vacation.
B. School was on break.

A. The air conditioner broke.
B. The family went to the beach.

A. Mom gave the girl fever medicine.
B. The girl had a fever.

A. The bread was dry.
B. We made French toast.

A. The company's stock went up.
B. The company's posted strong earnings.

A. I put my clothes in the washing machine.
B. My clothes got dirty.

A. My friend celebrated with their family.
B. My friend got a promotion.

A. The basketball player was shoved.
B. The basketball player took a free throw.

A. Alice missed her flight.
B. Alice didn't wake up.

A. The floor was wet.
B. The man sued.

A. It rained.
B. The picnic was cancelled.

A. The girl didn't wear her sweater.
B. The girl caught a cold.

A. A search party was assembled.
B. The man got lost in the woods.

A. Ted went out drinking.
B. Ted had a hangover.

A. Bob opened the jar and was frustrated.
B. Alice ate the last cookie.

A. Jimmy took the last piece of cake.
B. Mom rinsed the tray.
